DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Perfil epidemiolуgico e clнnico dos casos de tuberculose em Ipatinga, Minas Gerais
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Epidemiological and clinical profile Tuberculosis cases in Ipatinga, Minas Gerais

DETALHAMENTO-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-PERIODICO-OU-REVISTA: Brazilian Journal of Surgery and Clinical Research

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: A tuberculose (TB) й uma doenзa infecciosa de transmissгo inalatуria causada pelo Mycobacterium tuberculosis. Й uma preocupaзгo, dada a alta prevalкncia, morbidade e mortalidade. Ipatinga й um dos municнpios de alta carga da doenзa no estado de Minas Gerais. O objetivo do estudo foi analisar o perfil epidemiolуgico e clнnico dos pacientes com tuberculose notificados em Ipatinga pelo Programa de Controle da Tuberculose (PCT) no perнodo de 2004 a 2014. Foi realizado estudo epidemiolуgico transversal, observacional de sйrie temporal. Foram analisados 1.098 casos notificados como TB, sendo perceptнvel tendкncia de queda do nъmero de casos ao longo dos anos. Houve predomнnio do sexo masculino (66,2%), da faixa etбria de 15 a 59 anos (83,9%), da raзa branca e parda e do baixo nнvel de escolaridade. A maioria dos casos era de residentes no municнpio (74,9%), sendo distribuнdos irregularmente entre os bairros. Clinicamente predominou casos novos (85,9%), forma pulmonar (80,9%), sendo os agravos associados mais frequentes o alcoolismo (15,3%), Sнndrome da Imunodeficiкncia Adquirida (AIDS) (8,3%) e diabetes (5,7%). Os desfechos clнnicos foram: cura em 71,4%, abandono em 8,3% e 0,2% de multidrogarresistкncia. O perfil dos pacientes notificados encontra-se de acordo com o encontrado na literatura.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Tuberculosis (TB) is an infectious disease transmitted by inhalation and caused by Mycobacterium tuberculosis. It remains a concern, given the high prevalence, morbidity and mortality. Ipatinga is one of the municipalities with high disease burden in the state of Minas Gerais. The objective was to analyze the epidemiological and clinical profile of tuberculosis patients reported in Ipatinga by the Tuberculosis Control Program (PCT) of the municipality. A cross-sectional, observational, epidemiological study was carried out in a time series with the analysis of data from patients notified with tuberculosis (TB) from 2004 to 2014. A total of 1.098 cases were reported as TB, of which 821 were residents of the city. There was a decrease in the number of cases along the years. The cases were predominantly male (66.2%), 15 to 59 years old (83.9%), caucasian and afrodescendent, and with low schooling. The majority residing in the municipality (74.9%) and distributed irregularly between the districts. The prevalence of new cases (85.9%), pulmonary form (80.9%), alcoholism (15.3%), AIDS (8.3%) and diabetes (5.7%) ocurred. The clinical outcomes were: cure in 71.4%, abandonment in 8.3% and 0.2% multidrug-resistant. Profile of the notified patients is in accordance with those presented in the literature.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Technological Perspectives for Propulsion on Nuclear Attack Submarines
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Technological Perspectives for Propulsion on Nuclear Attack Submarines

DETALHAMENTO-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-PERIODICO-OU-REVISTA: WORLD JOURNAL OF NUCLEAR SCIENCE AND TECHNOLOGY

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
This work aims to present the historical context in which the current understanding of the phenomenon of the direct contact condensation started to call the scientific society attention. The development of nuclear power plants Light Water Reactors demanded a safe way to collect and treat the water used to cool the reactor. Some characteristics of this water in a high energetic thermodynamic state made it unsuitable to be directly discharged in the atmosphere. Small room relieves tanks were developed to contain this discharge.
These tanks were partially fulfilled with water, and the vapor injection created a vapor plume. In the interface of liquid and vapor, the thermal exchange would be increased by the characteristic turbulence of this region.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: A CFD analysis of the flow dynamics of a directly-operated safety relief valve
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: A CFD analysis of the flow dynamics of a directly-operated safety relief valve

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: A three-dimensional numerical study on steady state was designed for a safety relief valve using several openings and inlet pressures. The ANSYS-CFX® commercial code was used as a CFD tool to obtain several properties using dry saturated steam revised by IAPWS-IF97. Mass flow and discharge coefficient calculated from simulations are compared to the ASME 2011a Section 1 standard. The model presented constant behavior for opening lifts smaller than 12mm and is very reasonable when compared to the standard (ASME). In addition, the conventional procedure to design normal disc force assumes that all the fluid mechanical energy was converted into work; however, the CFD simulations showed that average normal disc force is about 19% lower than theoretical ASME force, which could prevent the valve oversizing. A numerical validation was conducted for a transonic air flow through a converging?diverging diffuser geometry to verify the solver's ability to capture the position and intensity of a shockwave: the results showed good agreement with the benchmark experiments.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: A three-dimensional numerical study on steady state was designed for a safety relief valve using several openings and inlet pressures. A numerical validation was conducted for a transonic air flow through a converging?diverging diffuser geometry to verify the solver's ability to capture the position and intensity of a shockwave: the results showed good agreement with the benchmark experiments.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Constructal Law of Institutions within Social Organizations
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Constructal Law of Institutions within Social Organizations

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
This work looked for a unifying theory between physical-biological domain and social sciences. Constructal law unified physical and biological domain by telling the general sense in which flow systems tend to evolve. Management theory looks for relations between institutions and human agency. Although
being state of mind entities, institutions follow constructal law. This work proposed the main organization flows are information and credit. Biologic instincts derived from Darwinian natural selection are the driving or blocking forces of such flows. Once biologic instincts systematically block information
and credit flows in large numbers, this work proposed every human organization must have institutions to inhibit some behaviors. Those institutions need to be present, at least partially, in formal rules of social groups. This way it is possible to predict expansion or downfall of human groups using objective
and quantifiable data. Therefore, further studies may employ classical history to confirm this theory. This work analyzed some case studies to show qualitatively the application of proposed theory. Concluding, this work gave physically-biologically grounded guidance for institutional changes.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Proposal of a Methodology for the Assessment of Security Levels of IoT Wireless Sensor Networks in Nuclear Environments
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Proposal of a Methodology for the Assessment of Security Levels of IoT Wireless Sensor Networks in Nuclear Environments

DETALHAMENTO-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-PERIODICO-OU-REVISTA: WORLD JOURNAL OF NUCLEAR SCIENCE AND TECHNOLOGY

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The use of Wireless Sensor Networks (WSN) associated with the reality of an Internet of Things (IoT) scenario in nuclear environments is a growing secu-rity concern. In this context, standards are intensified to preserve the physical integrity of these facilities considered to be highly critical due to the size of the impacts of safety accidents. This paper presents a proposal to build a metho-dology to evaluate the security levels of WSNs with IoT devices when used in nuclear areas. The proposal is initially based on related work to establish a more concrete initial framework and is structured in consistent steps from previous scientific studies.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: The use of Wireless Sensor Networks (WSN) associated with the reality of an Internet of Things (IoT) scenario in nuclear environments is a growing secu-rity concern. This paper presents a proposal to build a metho-dology to evaluate the security levels of WSNs with IoT devices when used in nuclear areas. The proposal is initially based on related work to establish a more concrete initial framework and is structured in consistent steps from previous scientific studies.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Studies on Capacity Expansion of Fuel Plants for Nuclear Research Reactors
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Studies on Capacity Expansion of Fuel Plants for Nuclear Research Reactors

DETALHAMENTO-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-PERIODICO-OU-REVISTA: WORLD JOURNAL OF NUCLEAR SCIENCE AND TECHNOLOGY

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The demand for nuclear fuel for research reactors is rising worldwide. Thus, the production facilities of this kind of fuel need reliable guidance on how to augment their production in order to meet the increasing demand efficiently and safely. We proposed a specific procedure for increasing production ca-pacity. That procedure was tested with data from a real plant, which produces plate-type fuel elements loaded with LEU U3Si2-Al fuel. The test was made by means of discrete event simulation, and the results indicated the proposed procedure is efficient in raising production capacity.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: The demand for nuclear fuel for research reactors is rising worldwide. DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Thermal Hydraulic Analysis Improvement for the IEA-R1 Research Reactor and Fuel Assembly Design Modification
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Thermal Hydraulic Analysis Improvement for the IEA-R1 Research Reactor and Fuel Assembly Design Modification

DETALHAMENTO-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-PERIODICO-OU-REVISTA: WORLD JOURNAL OF NUCLEAR SCIENCE AND TECHNOLOGY

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: This paper presents the sequence of activities to improve the thermal hydrau-lic analysis of the IEA-R1 research reactor to operate in safe conditions after power upgrade from 2 to 5 MW and core size reduction from 30 to 24 fuel as-semblies. A realistic analysis needs the knowledge of the actual operation con-ditions (heat flow, flow rates) beyond the geometric data and the uncertainties associated with manufacturing and measures. A dummy fuel assembly was designed and constructed to measure the actual flow rate through the core fuel assemblies and its pressure drop. First results showed that the flow dis-tribution over the core is nearly uniform. Nevertheless, the values are below than the calculated ones and the core bypass flow rate is greater than those es-timated previously. Based on this, several activities were performed to identify and reduce the bypass flow, such as reduction of the flow rate through the sample irradiators, closing some unnecessary secondary holes on the matrix plate, improvement in the primary flow rate system and better fit of the core components on the matrix plate. A sub-aquatic visual system was used as an important tool to detect some bypass flow path. After these modifications, the fuel assemblies flow rate increased about 13%. Additional tests using the dummy fuel assembly were carried out to measure the internal flow distribu-tion among the rectangular channels. The results showed that the flow rate through the outer channels is 10% - 15% lower than the internal ones. The flow rate in the channel formed between two adjacent fuel assemblies is an es-timated parameter and it is difficult to measure because this is an open chan-nel. A new thermal hydraulic analysis of the outermost plates of the fuel as-semblies takes into account all this information. Then, a fuel design modification was proposed with the reduction of 50% in the uranium quantity in the outermost fuel plates. In order to avoid the oxidation of the outermost plates by

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Classification of natural circulation two-phase flow image patterns based on self-organizing maps of full frame DCT coefficients
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Classification of natural circulation two-phase flow image patterns based on self-organizing maps of full frame DCT coefficients

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Many of the recent nuclear power plant projects use natural circulation as heat removal mechanism. The accuracy of heat transfer parameters estimation has been improved through models that require precise prediction of two-phase flow pattern transitions. Image patterns of natural circulation instabilities were used to construct an automated classification system based on Self-Organizing Maps (SOMs). The system is used to investigate the more appropriate image features to obtain classification success. An efficient automated classification system based on image features can enable better and faster experimental procedures on two-phase flow phenomena studies. A comparison with a previous fuzzy inference study was foreseen to obtain classification power improvements.
In the present work, frequency domain image features were used to characterize three different natural
circulation two-phase flow instability stages to serve as input to a SOM clustering algorithm. Full-Frame Discrete Cosine Transform (FFDCT) coefficients were obtained for 32 image samples for each instability stage and were organized as input database for SOM training. A systematic training/test methodology was used to verify the classification method. Image database was obtained from two-phase flow experiments performed on the Natural Circulation Facility (NCF) at Instituto de Pesquisas Energйticas e Nucleares (IPEN/CNEN), Brazil.
A mean right classification rate of 88.75% was obtained for SOMs trained with 50% of database. A mean right classificationrate of 93.98% was obtained for SOMs trained with 75% of data. These mean rates were obtained through 1000 different randomly sampled training data. FFDCT proved to be a very efficient and compact image feature to improve image-based classification systems. Fuzzy inference showed to be more flexible and able to adapt to simpler statistical features from only one image profile. FFDCT features resulted in more precise results when applied to a SOM neural ne

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Two-phase flow bubble detection method applied to natural circulation system using fuzzy image processing
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Two-phase flow bubble detection method applied to natural circulation system using fuzzy image processing

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Natural circulation cooling systems are currently used in new nuclear reactors. Over the last decades, research in these systems has focused in the study of flow and heat transfer parameters. A particular area of interest is the estimation of two-phase flow parameters by image processing and pattern recognition using intelligent processing. Several methods have been proposed to identify objects of interest in bubbly two-phase images. Edge detection is an important task to estimate flow parameters, in which the bubbles are segmented to obtain several features, such as void fraction, area, and diameter. However, current methods face difficulties in determining those parameters in high bubble-density two-phase flow images. Here, a new edge detection method is proposed to segment bubbles in natural circulation instability images. The new method (Fuzzy Contrast Standard Deviation ? FUZCON) uses Fuzzy Logic and image standard deviation estimates of locally measured contrast levels. Images
were obtained through an experimental circuit made of glass, which enables imaging flow patterns of natural circulation cycles at ambient pressure. The results indicated important improvements on edge detection efficiency for high void fraction estimation on high-density two-phase flow bubble images, when compared to classical detectors, without the need to use smoothing algorithms or human intervention.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: A System Status Definition to Improve Behavior Description in Specifications Based on Constructal Law
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: A System Status Definition to Improve Behavior Description in Specifications Based on Constructal Law

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: System behavior description using states faces problems like state explosion, lack of clear definition of state, state identification and coordination between multiple agents. The goals of this work are to ease design activity, to reduce engineering efforts, and to mitigate project risks. The proposed way is to improve information flow during design by adding definitions and some protocols or rules for communicating a specification or design description. This work presented an objective definition of system status (way of interaction with the rest of the world) along other concepts. This work focused in definitions as mind entities and their importance to rationalize work and mitigate project risks during design. This article presented some simple examples to illustrate the advantages of each aspect of proposed definition of system status and discussed limits and exceptions for such definition. The key finding was the proposed definition which was the simplest while keeping completeness at a given product breakdown level. Such definition of status enforced formal segregation of needs and solutions, and eased the inclusion of behavior definition in specifications.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Economically Feasible Mobile Nuclear Power Plant for Merchant Ships and Remote Clients
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Economically Feasible Mobile Nuclear Power Plant for Merchant Ships and Remote Clients

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Recent studies point at reduction of atmospheric pollution using nuclear energy for merchant ships. This work aims at the development of an economically competitive nuclear power solution for merchant ships propulsion. The solution also addresses the requirements of a wider market, like islands, offshore oil platforms and remote cities. System engineering and analysis at various product breakdown levels also propose architectural options to improve competitiveness of nuclear power in mobile nuclear power plants. Analyses include a market research on clients and technical considerations on nuclear energy costs. Results show that an enterprise, which delivers electric power to remote clients and dedicates to management of all nuclear aspects, seems to be the best organizational and technical choice. Besides, ships should be of modular type and the mobile nuclear power plants should be easily detachable at sea. Only container ships and remote islands demand enough power to justify use of nuclear power. Nuclear power has high probability to be economically competitive for large container ships, however only if public policies impose levels of risks akin to other industries.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Procedures for manufacturing an instrumented nuclear fuel element
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Procedures for manufacturing an instrumented nuclear fuel element

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
The IEA-R1 is an open pool research reactor that operated for many years at 2 MW. The reactor uses plate type fuel elements which are formed by assembling eighteen parallel fuel plates. During the years of reactor operation at 2 MW, thermohydraulic safety margins with respect to design limits were always very high. However, more intense oxidation on some external fuel plates was observed when the reactor power was increased to 5 MW. At this new power level, the safety margins are significantly reduced due to the increase of the heat flux on the plates. In order to measure, experimentally, the fuel plate temperature under operation, an instrumented fuel element was constructed to obtain temperature experimental data at various positions of one or more fuel plates in the fuel element. The manufacturing method is characterized by keeping the original fuel element design specifications. Type K stainless sheathed thermocouples are mounted into supports pads in unrestricted positions. During the fuel element assembling, the supports pads with the thermocouples are mechanically fixed by
interference between two adjacent fuel plates. The thermocouple wires are directed through the space existing at the bottom of the mounting slot where the fuel plate is fixed to the side plates. The number of thermocouples installed is not restricted and depends only on adaptations that can be made on the mounting slots of the standard fuel element side plates. This work describes the manufacturing procedures for assembling such an instrumented fuel element.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: New Formulation for Semi-Empirical Correlations for Penetration Jets
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: New Formulation for Semi-Empirical Correlations for Penetration Jets

DETALHAMENTO-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-PERIODICO-OU-REVISTA: WORLD JOURNAL OF NUCLEAR SCIENCE AND TECHNOLOGY

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Correlations for the extension of a water vapor jet injected in a liquid pool were historically proposed considering the mass flux (kg/m2/s) as a constant. The results were satisfactory, however adjusting the values by linear regression. Although, it presents the following drawbacks: 1) the formulation is only valid for the specific range of data for what it was created; 2) it does not allow the analytical evaluation of the heat transfer coefficient from the extension equation. This paper proposes a new formulation for the calculation of
the mass flux, in such a way to remove both of these drawbacks.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:

the mass flux, in such a way to remove both of these drawbacks.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: A CFD analysis of blockage length on a partially blocked fuel rod
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: A CFD analysis of blockage length on a partially blocked fuel rod

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: After a loss of coolant accident (LOCA), fuel rods may balloon. The swelling can partially block the flow channel, affecting the coolability during reflood phase. In order to analyze the influence of blockage length, using a radial block-age of 90%, varying just the blockage length, many steady state numerical simulations has been done using Ansys-CFX code to verify thermal-hydraulic properties according to different forced cooled conditions. Temperature peaks are observed on cladding, followed by a temperature drop. A 5x5 fuel assembly, with 9 centered ballooned fuel rod, flow redistribution inside channels can also be captured, indicating an overheating zone. Therefore, this study conclude, for the same boundary conditions, the longer the blockage length originated after LOCA events, the higher are the clad temperatures, indicating the possibility of overheat during transient conditions on reflood.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: After a loss of coolant accident (LOCA), fuel rods may balloon. The swelling can partially block the flow channel, affecting the coolability during reflood phase. DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: A Reliability-Based Strategy for the Analysis of Single Proton Exchange Membrane Fuel Cells
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: A Reliability-Based Strategy for the Analysis of Single Proton Exchange Membrane Fuel Cells

AUTORES.NOME-COMPLETO-DO-AUTOR: DE OLIVEIRA, PATRICIA DA SILVA PAGETTI
AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: DE OLIVEIRA, PATRICIA DA SILVA PAGETTI

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
The development of power conversion systems based on fuel cells has been demanding reliability tudies since the requirements associated with cost and durability of these technological products have become fundamental to their acceptance by the energy market. The experimental part of the reliability study presented in this work consisted of performing life tests with single proton exchange membrane fuel cells (PEMFCs). The proposed reliability analysis methodology covered the application of qualitative and quantitative techniques. In the qualitative approach, a Failure Mode and Effect Analysis was developed in order to identify and evaluate all potential failures associated with the operation of fuel cells. In the quantitative approach, a statistical analysis was applied to the sample data generated in long-term steady-state tests of these devices. A two-parameter exponential distribution was fitted to data and the
maximum likelihood estimate for the mean time to failure (MTTF) of the fuel cells was calculated. It is important to point out that the tests performed under the scope of this study were the first long-term experiments performed with the fuel cells produced in the laboratories of IPEN-CNEN/SP, Brazil. Although the results indicated that fuel cell performance and durability were still at a level below the targets normally established for similar commercial devices, the improvement of the main components of PEMFCs has been the objective of several projects developed at the institute. Thus, the main benefit brought by this study is the proposed methodology, which can be implemented as part of a reliability growth analysis of the fuel cells and can be integrated into the design process of these devices.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
The development of power conversion systems based on fuel cells has been demanding reliability tudies since the requirements associated with cost and durability of these technological products have become fundamental to their acceptance by the energy market. The experimental part of the reliability study presented in this work consisted of performing life tests with single proton exchange membrane fuel cells (PEMFCs). The proposed reliability analysis methodology covered the application of qualitative and quantitative techniques. In the qualitative approach, a Failure Mode and Effect Analysis was developed in order to identify and evaluate all potential failures associated with the operation of fuel cells. In the quantitative approach, a statistical analysis was applied to the sample data generated in long-term steady-state tests of these devices. A two-parameter exponential distribution was fitted to data and the
maximum likelihood estimate for the mean time to failure (MTTF) of the fuel cells was calculated. It is important to point out that the tests performed under the scope of this study were the first long-term experiments performed with the fuel cells produced in the laboratories of IPEN-CNEN/SP, Brazil. Although the results indicated that fuel cell performance and durability were still at a level below the targets normally established for similar commercial devices, the improvement of the main components of PEMFCs has been the objective of several projects developed at the institute. Thus, the main benefit brought by this study is the proposed methodology, which can be implemented as part of a reliability growth analysis of the fuel cells and can be integrated into the design process of these devices.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Two-phase flow void fraction estimation based on bubble image segmentation using Randomized Hough Transform with Neural Network (RHTN)
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Two-phase flow void fraction estimation based on bubble image segmentation using Randomized Hough Transform with Neural Network (RHTN)

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
The International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) has been encouraging the use of passive cooling systems in new designs of nuclear power plants. Next nuclear reactor generations are intended to have simpler and robust safety resources. Natural Circulation based systems hold an undoubtedly prominent position among these. The study of limiting conditions of these systems has led to instability behavior analysis where many different two-phase flow patterns are present. Void fraction is a key parameter in thermal transfer analysis of these flow instability conditions. This work presents a new method to estimate void fraction from images captured of an experimental two-phase flow circuit. The method integrates a set of Artificial Neural Networks with a modified Randomized Hough Transform to make multiple scans over acquired images, using crescent-sized masks. This method was called Randomized Hough Transform with Neural Network (RHTN). Each different mask size is chosen according with bubble sizes, which are the main ?objects of interest? in this image analysis. Images are segmented using
fuzzy inference with different parameters adjusted based on acquisition focus. Void fraction calculation considers the volume of the imaged geometrical section of flow inside cylindrical glass tubes considering the acquisition depth-of-field used. The bubble volume is estimated based on geometrical parameters inferred for each detected bubble. The image database is obtained from experiments performed on a vertical two-phase flow circuit made of cylindrical glass where flow-patterns visualization is possible. The results have shown that the estimation method had good agreement with increasing void fraction experimental values. RHTN has been very efficient as bubble detector with very low ?false-positive? cases (< 0.004%) due robustness obtained through integration between Artificial Neural Networks with Randomized Hough Transforms.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: RANS-Based CFD Calculation for Pressure Drop and Mass Flow Rate Distribution in an MTR Fuel Assembly

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: ANDRADE, D.A.;ANDRADE, DA;ANDRADE, Delvonei A.;ANDRADE, Delvonei Alves de;D.A. Andrade;de Andrade, Delvonei Alves;Andrade, Dr. Delvonei Alves de;ANDRADE, DELVONEI;ANDRADE, D. A.;DE ANDRADE, DELVONEI A.;DE ANDRADE, D.A.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
This work presents a Reynolds-averaged Navier Stokes?based computational fluid dynamics
methodology for the calculation of pressure drop and mass flow rate distribution in a material test reactor
flat-plate-type standard fuel assembly (SFA) of the IEA-R1 Brazilian research reactor to predict future
improvements in newer SFA designs. The results improve the understanding of the origin of fuel plate
oxidation due to high temperatures, and consequently, due to the internal flow dynamics. All numerical
analyses were performed with the ANSYS-CFX® commercial code. The observed results show that the
movement pin decreases the central channel mass flow due to the length of the vortex at the inlet region.
However, the outlet nozzle showed greater general influence in the flow dynamics. It should have a more
gradual cross-section transition being away from the fuel plates or a squarer-shaped design to get a more homogeneous mass flow distribution. Optimizing both regions could lead to a better cooling condition. The validation of the IEA-R1 numerical methodology was made by comparing the McMaster University?s dummy model experiment with a numerical model that uses the same numerical methodology. The experimental data were obtained with laser Doppler velocimetry, and the comparison showed good agreement for both pressure drop and mass flow rate distribution using the Standard k-ω turbulence model.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Computer Simulator for the Research Reactor IPEN/MB-01
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Computer simulator for the research reactor IPEN/MB-01

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-3.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Instrumentaзгo para Operaзгo e Controle de Reatores

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: A computer simulator for the Nuclear Research Reactor IPEN / MB-01 was developed to be a tool for teaching, training, and recycling professionals. The simulator was developed on a SCADA platform (Supervision and Data Acquisition System) with support calculation software, where mathematical models, and graphical interface configurations form a friendly platform, which allows the trainee to be identified with the physical systems of the research reactor. Simplified modeling of the main physical phenomena related to the operation of the reactor, and the reactivity control systems, reactor cooling and reactor protection was used. The Simulator allows an HMI (Human-Machine Interaction) by manipulating system variables and monitoring trends in quantities during the operation of the reactor, showing an interactive tool for teaching, training and recycling for professionals in the Nuclear Reactor IPEN / MB -01, allowing simulations of the start, power and stop operations.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: A computer simulator for the Nuclear Research Reactor IPEN / MB-01 was developed to be a tool for teaching, training, and recycling professionals. DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Modeling dynamic scenarios for safety, reliability, availability, and maintainability analysis
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Modeling dynamic scenarios for safety, reliability, availability, and maintainability analysis

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Safety analysis uses probability combinatorial models like fault tree and/or event tree. Such methods have static basic events and do not consider complex scenarios of dynamic reliability, leading to conservative results. Reliability, availability, and maintainability (RAM) analysis using reliability block diagram (RBD) experience the same limitations. Continuous Markov chains model dynamic reliability scenarios but suffer from other limitations like states explosion and restriction of exponential life distribution only. Markov Regenerative Stochastic Petri Nets oblige complex mathematical formalism and still subject to state explosions for large systems. In the design of complex systems, distinct teams make safety and RAM analyses, each one adopting tools better fitting their own needs. Teams using different tools turns obscure the detection of problems and their correction is even harder. This work aims to improve design quality, reduce design conservatism, and ensure consistency by proposing a single and powerful tool to perform any probabilistic analysis. The suggested tool is the Stochastic Colored class of Petri Nets, which supplies hierarchical organization, a set of options for life distributions, dynamic reliability scenarios and simple and easy construction for large systems. This work also proposes more quality rules to assure model consistency. Such method for probabilistic analysis may have the effect of shifting systems design from ?redundancy, segregation and independency? approach to ?maintainability, maintenance and contingency procedures? approach. By modeling complex human and automated interventional scenarios, this method reduces capital costs and keeps safety and availability of systems.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Safety analysis uses probability combinatorial models like fault tree and/or event tree. DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Nutritional Evaluation of Brachiaria brizantha cv. marandu using Convolutional Neural Networks
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Nutritional Evaluation of Brachiaria brizantha cv. marandu using Convolutional Neural Networks

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The identification of plant nutritional stress based on visual symptoms is predominantly done manually and is performed by trained specialists to identify such anomalies. In addition, this process tends to be very time consuming, has a variability between crop areas and is often required for analysis at various points of the property. This work proposes an image recognition system that analyzes the nutritional status of the plant to help solve these problems. The methodology uses deep learning that automates the process of identifying and classifying nutritional stress of Brachiaria brizantha cv. marandu. An image recognition system was built and analyzes the nutritional status of the plant using the digital images of its leaves. The system identifies and classifies Nitrogen and Potassium deficiencies. Upon receiving the image of the pasture leaf, after a classification performed by a convolutional neural network (CNN), the system presents the result of the diagnosed nutritional status. Tests performed to identify the nutritional status of the leaves presented an accuracy of 96%. We are working to expand the data of the image database to obtain an increase in the accuracy levels, aiming at the training with a larger amount of information presented to CNN and, thus, obtaining results that are more expressive.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Psychometric model for safety culture assessment in nuclear research facilities
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Psychometric model for safety culture assessment in nuclear research facilities

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-3.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Seguranзa, Localizaзгo e Licenciamento de Reatores

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
A safe and reliable operation of nuclear power plants depends not only on technical performance, but also
on the people and on the organization. Organizational factors have been recognized as the main causal
mechanisms of accidents by research organizations through USA, Europe and Japan. Deficiencies related with these factors reveal weaknesses in the organization?s safety culture. A significant number of instruments to assess the safety culture based on psychometric models that evaluate safety climate through questionnaires, and which are based on reliability and validity evidences, have been published in health and ?safety at work? areas. However, there are few safety culture assessment instruments with these characteristics (reliability and validity) available on nuclear literature. Therefore, this work proposes an instrument to evaluate, with valid and reliable measures, the safety climate of nuclear research facilities. The instrument was developed based on methodological principles applied to research modeling and its psychometric properties were evaluated by a reliability analysis and validation of content, face and construct. The instrument was applied to an important nuclear research organization in Brazil. This organization comprises 4 research reactors and many nuclear laboratories. The survey results made possible a demographic characterization and the identification of some possible safety culture weaknesses and pointing out potential areas to be improved in the assessed organization. Good evidence of reliability with Cronbach?s alpha coefficient of 0.951 was obtained. Validation method was based on Exploratory Factor Analysis (EFA), using Principal Components Analysis (PCA) and Varimax orthogonal factor rotation. The results confirmed the unidimensionality of the items and, almost entirely, the conceptual framework of the safety culture proposed for the instrument. However, the results also suggested that some adjustments to the conceptual framework

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-CAPITULO.TITULO-DO-CAPITULO-DO-LIVRO: Stability of γ-UMo Nuclear Fuel Alloys by Thermal Analysis
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-CAPITULO.TITULO-DO-CAPITULO-DO-LIVRO-INGLES: Stability of γ-UMo Nuclear Fuel Alloys by Thermal Analysis

DETALHAMENTO-DO-CAPITULO.TITULO-DO-LIVRO: Current research in nuclear reactor technology in Brazil and worldwide
DETALHAMENTO-DO-CAPITULO.NOME-DA-EDITORA: Ed. Rijeka: Intech - Open Acess Publisher

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: In this work, results based on the utilization of thermal analysis (TA) technique for the study of the reactions in the γUxMo-Al-O system, are presented and discussed. The main goal is to first assess a criterion for the stability of γUMo alloys and to predict their behavior under fabrication and irradiation. High density γUxMo alloys, with hypoeutetoid compositions of x = 5 to 10%wt Mo, were prepared by vacuum induction melting, and homogenized under vacuum at 1000oC for 24 to 72 hours. Under a fixed thermal cycle, data generated by the reactions were continuously collected, to build heat flow curves as a function of temperature and time. Initial, maximum and the end temperatures were fixed as the same for the experimental TA cycles of both systems, as was the heating and cooling rates. The analysis of the curves shows that the resistance of the alloys with Al is sensitive to the composition, explaining the adoption of this as a criterion regarding the stability of γ-UxMo alloys. The analysis of the experimental results suggests the compositions between 7 and 8 % wt. Mo as the most stable ones, and supported the choices made here for the definition of parameters for the study of stability of the γ-UMo alloys.

Si el potencial de malignidad fuera detectado antes de que los tumores se tornen malignos, el tratamiento puede ser altamente eficaz y con altas probabilidades de cura.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
The International Workshop "Career Opportunities for Graduates in Nuclear Safety & Security" is focused on new generations of professionals and future members of the nuclear area who are interested in learning about the new concepts and academic and technical opportunities.

The workshop was promoted by IPEN/USP Postgraduate Program in Nuclear Technology from 10 to 12 December. It resulted from a partnership between IPEN - which organized and hosted the meeting -, Texas A & M University (United States) and the World Institute for Nuclear Security (WINS), through the Partnership for Nuclear Security program (PNS).

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Neste trabalho й aplicada a metodologia de matrizes de covariвncia e mйtodo de mнnimos quadrados na determinaзгo de uma curva de ajuste para obter uma funзгo de desempenho do poder ou a capacidade de separaзгo de uma ultracentrнfuga em funзгo de variбveis que sгo experimentalmente controladas. Os dados experimentais consistem em um conjunto de 460 experimentos, que sгo obtidos no processo de separaзгo isotуpica de urвnio por ultracentrifugaзгo. Sгo consideradas as incertezas experimentais associadas аs variбveis utilizadas para o cбlculo do poder de separaзгo, determinando assim uma matriz de covariвncia dos dados experimentais. As variбveis de controle que exercem uma influкncia significativa nos valores do poder de separaзгo sгo o fluxo de alimentaзгo, o corte e a pressгo na linha de produto. Apуs a validaзгo da qualidade do ajuste do modelo obtido, й realizada a anбlise dos resнduos, avaliando-se as premissas assumidas em relaзгo а sua aleatoriedade e independкncia e, principalmente, а verificaзгo da existкncia de heteroscedasticidade dos resнduos com qualquer variбvel explicativa do modelo de regressгo. Sгo construнdas as curvas de superfнcie do poder de separaзгo em funзгo das variбveis de controle para a comparaзгo do modelo ajustado em relaзгo aos pontos experimentais e para, finalmente, a determinaзгo de seus valores уtimos.

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-3.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Seguranзa, Localizaзгo e Licenciamento de Reatores

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: O objetivo deste trabalho й apresentar uma base de dados computacional que foi desenvolvido com o objetivo de armazenar e processar os dados relativos ao reator IEA-R1, localizado no Instituto de Pesquisas Energйticas e Nucleares, IPEN ? CNEN/SP. Alйm disso, a base de dados em questгo possui um viйs para cбlculo da anбlise probabilнstica de seguranзa para geraзгo de relatуrios para apoio а decisгo do usuбrio final. A coleta de dados visa a utilizaзгo destes em avaliaзхes quantitativas relacionadas а seguranзa, confiabilidade, disponibilidade e manutenзгo desta instalaзгo. Esta base de dados foi desenvolvida de modo a permitir que as informaзхes nela contidas sejam consultadas pelos usuбrios da rede corporativa (Intranet do IPEN) por meio de um sistema para intranet, sendo permitido acesso somente para profissionais da бrea devidamente cadastrados e mantidos por um administrador do sistema atravйs de mуdulos de seguranзa no sistema intranet. O modelo lуgico e fнsico representado por um diagrama de entidades e relacionamento para o gerenciamento de dados do sistema й baseado nas regras do IPEN - CNEN/SP. O sistema foi desenvolvido em linguagem de programaзгo PHP para acesso e manipulaзгo da base de dados em MYSQL permitindo, por meio de suas funcionalidades, fornecer as informaзхes armazenadas de forma otimizada e com bom desempenho.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: The objective of this work is to describe the database developed at IPEN-CNEN/SP for application in the Probabilistic Safety Assessment (PSA) of nuclear research reactors. The database is accessed by means of a computational program installed in the corporate computer network, named IPEN Intranet, and this access is allowed only to professionals previously registered. A system administrator according to IPEN Intranet security rules will control data updating, editing and searching tasks. The logical model and the physical structure of the database is represented by an Entity Relationship Model, which is based on the operational routines performed by IPEN-CNEN/SP users. The web application designed for the management of the database is named PSADB. It is developed with MySQL database software and PHP programming language. Data stored in this database are divided into modules that refer to technical specifications, operating history, maintenance history and failure events associated with the main components of the nuclear facilities.

DETALHAMENTO-DE-ORIENTACOES-CONCLUIDAS-P.NOME-DA-AGENCIA: Coordenaзгo de Aperfeiзoamento de Pessoal de Nнvel Superior

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Este trabalho tem por objetivo criar uma modelagem numйrica de um elemento combustнvel do reator de pesquisa IEA-R1 para estudos termo-hidrбulicos, analisando por meio de ferramenta computacional como se desenvolve a hidrodinвmica entre os canais do elemento combustнvel.
O intuito й o de validar o mйtodo numйrico computacional a fim de assegurar uma metodologia confiбvel e compatнvel com a realidade. Os resultados computacionais obtidos podem ser legitimados atravйs da comparaзгo entre os diversos estudos experimentais jб realizados ao longo da existкncia do IEA-R1, em operaзгo desde 1957.
O conhecimento da dinвmica do fluido nos canais do elemento do reator IEA-R1 tem grande importвncia para obtenзгo mais precisa dos parвmetros operacionais e fornecerб subsнdios para projetos de novos elementos combustнveis, ou estudos em outros componentes do reator que necessitem de anбlises hidrodinвmicas.
Estabelecendo uma metodologia confiбvel, estudos como o presente podem ser aplicados ao desenvolvimento de futuros reatores como o RMB, minimizando a necessidade de testes experimentais.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: This work aims to create a numerical modeling of an IEA-R1 research reactor fuel element for thermo-hydraulic studies.

DADOS-BASICOS-DE-ORIENTACOES-CONCLUIDAS-.TITULO: Modelo Numйrico para Cбlculo do Transitуrio Hidrбulico e Interaзгo Fluido-Estrutura em Sistemas de Transporte de Fluidos

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: O principal objetivo deste trabalho й realizar uma ampla anбlise dos mecanismos de interaзгo entre o fluido e a estrutura em sistemas de transporte de fluidos durante a ocorrкncia de transitуrios hidrбulicos. Para isso serб desenvolvido um modelo numйrico que contemple tais mecanismos fнsicos fornecendo importantes informaзхes sobre as variбveis associadas ao fluido e а estrutura (tubos, vбlvulas, curvas, suportes).
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: The main objective of this work is to perform a comprehensive analysis of the mechanisms of interaction between fluid and structure in fluid transport systems in the occurrence of hydraulic transients . A numerical model including such physical mechanisms providing important information on the variables associated with fluid and structure (pipes, valves, bends , brackets ) will be developed.

Este trabalho tem como objetivo o estudo in vitro para avaliar o efeito da radiaзгo gamma nos tecidos duros da cavidade oral, determinar a microdureza de superfнcie do esmaltedental antes e apуs a irradiaзгo gamma, determinar a microdureza de superfнcie da dentina radicular antes e apуs a irradiaзгo gama e 
determinar a microdureza de superfнcie do osso alveolarantes e apуs a irradiaзгo gama.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: This work aims the in vitro study to evaluate the effect of gamma radiation in the hard tissues of the oral cavity , determine the enamel surface microhardness before and after gamma irradiation, to determine the hardness of the surface of the root dentin before and after gamma irradiation and determine the microhardness of the surface of the alveolar bone before and after gamma irradiation .

DADOS-BASICOS-DE-ORIENTACOES-CONCLUIDAS-.TITULO-INGLES: Epidemiological and Operational Indicators Analysis of the Tuberculosis Control Program of Ipatinga Municipality, Minas Gerais, from 2004 to 2014

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: A tuberculose (TB) й uma doenзa infecciosa, cujos indicadores epidemiolуgicos demonstram se tratar de um grave problema de saъde pъblica. O Brasil faz parte do grupo de paнses prioritбrios para aзхes de tuberculose no mundo, e o municнpio de Ipatinga se destaca entre os de elevada carga da doenзa no estado de Minas Gerais. O objetivo do presente estudo й a anбlise dos indicadores epidemiolуgicos e operacionais do Programa de Controle da Tuberculose de Ipatinga (PCT) de 2004 a 2014. A metodologia estб focada em estudo retrospectivo, de dados de pacientes que apresentaram tuberculose no passado; observacional, pois nгo houve intervenзгo na histуria da doenзa; longitudinal de sйrie temporal para o perнodo de seguimento compreendido entre 2004 e 2014. Os dados foram obtidos por meio das fichas de notificaзгo de tuberculose do Sistema de Informaзгo de Agravos de Notificaзгo (SINAN). Este estudo foi aprovado pelo Comitк de Йtica em Pesquisa, CEP/UNILESTE, CAAE:45295415.4.0000.5095. Os dados clнnicos e epidemiolуgicos predominantes entre os 1.098 casos de TB foram: sexo masculino (66,2%), faixa etбria de 15 a 59 anos (83,9%), raзa branca e parda e baixo nнvel de escolaridade; casos novos (85,9%), forma pulmonar (80,9%), agravos associados como alcoolismo (15,3%), AIDS (8,3%) e diabetes (5,7%). Os indicadores evidenciaram uma queda de 24,2% na incidкncia e 30,5 % na mortalidade, aumento na realizaзгo de sorologia para HIV de 34,6% para 75,4%, baixa realizaзгo de tratamento diretamente observado (11,4%) e de cultura de escarro (8,2%). A situaзгo de encerramento entre casos novos foi: cura em 80,9%, abandono 10,8%, уbitos 4,5% e transferкncia 3,8%. A coinfecзгo TB/HIV associou-se positivamente com (p<0,05): faixa etбria de 15 a 59 anos, acometimento extrapulmonar da doenзa e ausкncia de confirmaзгo do caso. Foi encontrada associaзгo significativa da cura com as variбveis sexo feminino, ausкncia de AIDS, de alcoolismo e de HIV; do abandono com sexo masculino, faixa etбria de 1
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Tuberculosis (TB) is an infectious disease whose epidemiological indicators show that it is a serious public health problem. Brazil is part of the priority group of countries for tuberculosis actions in the world, with the municipality of Ipatinga standing out among those with a high burden of disease in the state of Minas Gerais. The objective of the present study is the analysis of the epidemiological and operational indicators of Ipatinga Tuberculosis Control Program (PCT) from 2004 to 2014. The methodology is focused on a retrospective study, whose data from patients with Tuberculosis occurred in the past; observational study, without intervention in the history of the disease; longitudinal temporal study for the follow-up period from 2004 to 2014. Data were obtained through the Tuberculosis Notification Form of the Notification of Injury Information System (SINAN) and approved by the Ethics Committee in Research (CEP/UNILESTE), CAAE: 45295415.4.0000.5095. The predominant clinical and epidemiological data among the 1,098 cases of TB were: male sex (66.2%), age group of 15 to 59 years old (83.9%), caucasian and afrodescendent race, and low schooling; new cases (85.9%), pulmonary form (80.9%), associated diseases such as alcoholism (15.3%), AIDS (8.3%) and diabetes (5.7%). The indicators showed a decrease in incidence (24.2%) and mortality (30.5%), an increase in serology for HIV from 34.6% to 75.4%, a low rate of directly observed treatment (11.4%) and sputum culture (8.2%). The treatment outcome among new cases was: success rate in 80.9%, loss to follow-up 10.8%, death 4.5% and transference 3.8%. TB / HIV co-infection was positively associated with (p <0.05): age range of 15 to 59 years, extrapulmonary TB involvement and absence of case confirmation. DADOS-BASICOS-DE-ORIENTACOES-CONCLUIDAS-.TITULO: Desenvolvimento de um Elemento Combustнvel Instrumentado para o Reator de Pesquisa IEA-R1
DADOS-BASICOS-DE-ORIENTACOES-CONCLUIDAS-.TITULO-INGLES: Development of an Instrumented Fuel Assembly for the IEA-R1 Research Reactor

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Apуs o aumento de potкncia do reator IEA-R1 de 2 MW para 5 MW observou-se um aumento da taxa de corrosгo nas placas laterais de alguns elementos combustнveis e algumas dъvidas surgiram com relaзгo ao valor de vazгo utilizada nas anбlises termo-hidrбulicas. A fim de esclarecer e medir a distribuiзгo de vazгo real pelos elementos combustнveis que compхe o nъcleo do reator IEA-R1, um elemento combustнvel protуtipo, sem material nuclear, chamado DMPV-01 (Dispositivo para Medida de Pressгo e Vazгo), em escala real, foi projetado e construнdo em alumнnio. A vazгo no canal entre dois elementos combustнveis й muito difнcil de estimar ou ser medida. Esta vazгo й muito importante no processo de resfriamento das placas laterais. Este trabalho apresenta a concepзгo e construзгo de um elemento combustнvel instrumentado para medir a temperatura real nestas placas laterais para melhor avaliar as condiзхes de resfriamento do combustнvel. 	Quatorze termopares foram instalados neste elemento combustнvel instrumentado. Quatro termopares em cada canal lateral e quatro no canal central, alйm de um termopar no bocal de entrada e outro no bocal de saнda do elemento. Existem trкs termopares para medida de temperatura do revestimento e um para a temperatura do fluido em cada canal. Trкs sйries de experimentos, para trкs configuraзхes distintas, foram realizadas com o elemento combustнvel instrumentado. Em dois experimentos uma caixa de alumнnio foi instalada ao redor do nъcleo para reduzir o escoamento transverso entre os elementos combustнveis e medir o impacto na temperatura das placas externas. 
Dada a tamanha quantidade de informaзхes obtidas e sua utilidade no projeto, melhoria e capacitaзгo na construзгo, montagem e fabricaзгo de elementos combustнveis instrumentados, este projeto constitui um importante marco no estudo de nъcleos de reatores de pesquisa. As soluзхes propostas podem ser amplamente utilizadas para outros reatores de pesquisa.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
After the IEA-R1 upgrade from 2 MW to 5 MW it was observed that the corrosion rate increased in a lateral plate of one fuel element and some issues appeared concerning the flow values used in the thermal-hydraulic analysis. In order to clear it up and measure the actual flow distribution among the fuel elements composing the IEA-R1 active core, a dummy element without nuclear fuel material, called DMPV-01 (Pressure and Flow Measurement Device), full scale, was designed and manufactured in aluminum. The flow rate in the channel between two fuel assemblies is very difficult to estimate or measure. This flow rate is very important to the cooling process of the external plates. This work presents the design and construction of an instrumented fuel assembly in order to measure the actual temperature in these lateral plates. 
	Fourteen thermocouples were installed in this instrumented fuel assembly. Four in each lateral channel, one in the inlet nozzle and one in the outlet nozzle. There are three thermocouples in each channel to measure the clad temperature and one thermocouple to measure the fluid temperature. 
	Three series of experiments, for three different core configuration were carried out with the instrumented fuel assembly. In two experiments a box was installed around the core to reduce the cross flow between the fuel assembly and measure the impact in the temperatures of external plates. 
	Given the amount of information generated and its utility in the design, improvement and qualification in construction, assembly and manufacturing of instrumented fuel, this project turned out to be an important landmark on the thermal-hydraulic study of research reactor cores. The proposed solutions could be useful for other research reactors.

DADOS-BASICOS-DE-ORIENTACOES-CONCLUIDAS-.TITULO: Anбlise de vibraзхes induzidas em elementos combustнveis tipo feixe de placas de reatores nucleares
DADOS-BASICOS-DE-ORIENTACOES-CONCLUIDAS-.TITULO-INGLES: Experimental analysis of critical velocity in flat plate fuel element for nuclear research reactors

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Os elementos combustнveis de um reator nuclear de pesquisa tipo MTR (?Materials Test Reactor?) sгo, em sua grande maioria, formados por placas de combustнvel revestidas com alumнnio contendo no cerne silicileto de urвnio (U3Si2) disperso em matriz de alumнnio. Essas placas possuem espessura da ordem de milнmetros e comprimentos muito maiores em relaзгo а sua espessura. Elas sгo dispostas paralelamente no conjunto que forma o elemento combustнvel, de maneira a formar canais entre elas com poucos milнmetros de espessura, por onde escoa o fluido de refrigeraзгo (бgua leve ou бgua pesada). Essa configuraзгo, associada а necessidade de um escoamento com altas vazхes para garantir o resfriamento das placas em operaзгo, pode gerar problemas de falhas mecвnicas das placas de combustнvel devido аs vibraзхes induzidas pelo escoamento nos canais e, consequentemente acidentes de proporзхes graves no caso de velocidade crнtica podendo gerar colapso das placas. Embora nгo haja ruptura das placas combustнveis durante o colapso, as deflexхes permanentes excessivas das placas podem causar bloqueio do canal de escoamento no nъcleo do reator e levar a superaquecimento nas placas. 
Para este trabalho foram desenvolvidos uma bancada experimental com capacidade para altas vazхes volumйtricas (Q=100 m3/h) e uma seзгo de testes que simula um elemento combustнvel do tipo placa com trкs canais de resfriamento. A seзгo de testes foi instrumentada com sensores de deformaзгo, sensores de pressгo piezoelйtricos, acelerфmetro e um tubo de pitot. As dimensхes da seзгo de testes foram baseadas no Projeto do Reator Multipropуsito Brasileiro (RMB) que estб sendo desenvolvido pela Comissгo Nacional de Energia Nuclear - CNEN.
Os experimentos programados permitiram um melhor entendimento da interaзгo fluido estrutura em elementos combustнveis tipo placa como: valores de frequкncias de vibraзхes naturais, instabilidade fluido elбstica e detecзгo de valores de velocidade crнtica. Os dados obtidos poder
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
The fuel elements of a nuclear research reactor type MTR ("Materials Test Reactor") are formed by plates of metal fuel based uranium alloy (U3Si2) and aluminum (Al). These plates have a thickness of the order of millimeters and greater length in relation to its thickness. They are arranged in parallel in the assembly forming the fuel element to form channels between them a few millimeters in thickness, through which there is a flow of the coolant (light water or heavy water). This configuration, combined with the need for a flow at high flow rates to ensure the cooling of the fuel element in operation, may create problems of mechanical failure of fuel plate due to the vibration induced by the flow in the channels. In the case of critical velocity may cause collapse of the plates. Although there is no rupture of the fuel plates during the collapse, excessive permanent deflection of the plates can cause blockage to the flow in the reactor core and lead to overheating of fuel element.
	For this study were developed an experimental bench capable of high volume flows (Q = 100 m3/h) and a test section that simulates a plate-like fuel element with three cooling channels. The test section was instrumented with strain-gauge sensors, piezoelectric pressure sensors, accelerometer and a tube of pitot. The dimensions of the test section were based on the design of the Brazilian Multipurpose Reactor (RMB) being developed by the National Energy Nuclear Commission (CNEN).
The programmed experiments allowed a better understanding of the interaction fluid structure in fuel elements type plate as: frequency values of natural vibrations, fluid elastic instability and the detection of critical velocity values. The data will allow a better understanding of the operational limits of the fuel elements designed to research reactors and comparisons with the criteria required for the operating license.

DADOS-BASICOS-DE-ORIENTACOES-CONCLUIDAS-.TITULO: Desenvolvimento de um modelo para a comunicaзгo de riscos e sua utilizaзгo para energia nuclear
DADOS-BASICOS-DE-ORIENTACOES-CONCLUIDAS-.TITULO-INGLES: RISK COMMUNICATION IN PREPARATION FOR NUCLEAR EMERGENCIES: A CASE STUDY IN ANGRA DOS REIS, RIO DE JANEIRO

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: O gerenciamento de riscos em uma instalaзгo perigosa, ou seja, aquela que pode ser origem de eventos acidentais severos, й necessбrio para a seguranзa de trabalhadores e de populaзхes vizinhas. Parte desse processo й a comunicaзгo dos riscos que propicia o diбlogo entre gestores da empresa e moradores das бreas de risco. A populaзгo que conhece os riscos a que estб exposta, como esses riscos sгo gerenciados e o que deve ser feito em uma situaзгo de emergкncia tende a se sentir mais segura e a confiar nas instituiзхes responsбveis pelo plano de emergкncia. Sem diбlogo entre empresa e pъblico, o conhecimento dos procedimentos a serem seguidos em caso de acidente nгo chega а populaзгo, ou quando chega, nгo hб confianзa dessas pessoas na sua eficбcia. Em Angra dos Reis, no litoral sul do estado do Rio de Janeiro, estб a Central Nuclear Almirante Бlvaro Alberto. No entorno dessa central nuclear existe uma populaзгo que, de acordo com o Plano de Emergкncia Externo, deverб ser evacuada ou ficar abrigada, caso ocorra um acidente na instalaзгo. Um trabalho de comunicaзгo de riscos entre esses moradores й necessбrio para que eles conheзam o plano de emergкncia e os procedimentos corretos para uma situaзгo de emergкncia, no entanto, pouco й feito para divulgar essas informaзхes gerando falta de confianзa na eficбcia do plano, alйm de muitas dъvidas e mitos. Esse trabalho apresenta uma anбlise da comunicaзгo dos riscos feita para a populaзгo local e o grau de conhecimento do plano de emergкncia externo por parte dessas pessoas.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Risk management in a hazardous installation, here as one that can be the source of severe accidents, is necessary for the safety of workers and the surrounding population. One part of this process is risk communication that enables dialogue between the company managers and people who live within risk area. People who are aware of the risks to which they are exposed, how these risks are handled and how to behave in an emergency situation tend to feel safer and to trust the institutions responsible for the emergency plan. Without dialogue, the population has no access to the procedures necessary in occurrence of an accident, and even if they do have access, there is no trust in the institution. In Angra dos Reis, on the southern coast of the state of Rio de Janeiro, there is the Almirante Бlvaro Alberto Nuclear Power Plant. In the surroundings of the power plant there is a population that, according to the External Emergency Plan, must be evacuated or sheltered in the occurrence of an accident. Communication with this population is crucial so that they become aware of the emergency plan and to its procedures, however little has been done to inform the population, which results in lack of trust, doubts and myths about the risks they are exposed. This paper presents an analysis of risk communication regarding local population surrounding the nuclear power plant in Angra dos Reis and the degree of knowledge of the external emergency plan by this population.

DADOS-BASICOS-DE-ORIENTACOES-CONCLUIDAS-.TITULO: Desenvolvimento de modelos analнtico e numйrico associados ao fenфmeno de condensaзгo por contato direto em tanque de alнvio de reator PWR
DADOS-BASICOS-DE-ORIENTACOES-CONCLUIDAS-.TITULO-INGLES: Development of analytical and numerical models associated to the condensation phenomenon by direct contact in PWR reactor relief tank

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: O presente trabalho tem por objetivo estabelecer modelo numйrico que permita o estudo de jatos de vapor de forma abrangente, variando-se livremente os parвmetros de entrada (dimensхes do tanque, pressгo do pressurizador, nъmero de furos, posiзгo dos furos, бrea dos furos, inclinaзгo, nнvel de бgua, altura do aspersor) que influenciam o Capacidade de Retenзгo a fim de se estabelecer condiзхes de projeto e configuraзхes уtimas nas quais o fluxo entбlpico possa ser maximizado, ou os requisitos estruturais do tanque possam ser reduzidos.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Present work presents a numerical model to the study of steam jets in a comprehensive way, freely varying the input parameters. Tank size, pressurizer pressure, number of holes, position and area of holes, slope, water level, sprinkler height are parameters influencing the Holding Capacity. The goal is to establish optimum design conditions and configurations in which the enthalpic flow can be maximized or the structural requirements of the tank can be reduced.

DADOS-BASICOS-DE-ORIENTACOES-CONCLUIDAS-.TITULO: Metodologia de especificaзгo e projeto aplicado a usinas nucleares mуveis
DADOS-BASICOS-DE-ORIENTACOES-CONCLUIDAS-.TITULO-INGLES: Specification and design methodology applied to mobile nuclear power plants

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: A importвncia de mйtodos de projeto vem crescendo nos ъltimos anos а medida que sistemas sуcio-tйcnicos complexos se tornam mais numerosos. Alйm da complexidade, o tamanho e o investimento financeiro destes sistemas amplificam a gravidade dos erros de projeto. O objetivo geral deste trabalho foi desenvolver uma metodologia de especificaзгo e projeto que reduza o tempo e energia para desenvolver um sistema complexo cujas funзхes sejam conhecidas a priori, gerenciando em paralelo os riscos. O objetivo especнfico foi verificar a viabilidade econфmica de usinas nucleares mуveis de pequeno porte. Este trabalho adotou como princнpio a lei construtal que prevк o sucesso de sistemas que facilitem os fluxos necessбrios а sua existкncia. Apуs a identificaзгo dos fatores chave para facilitar o fluxo de informaзхes, esta tese desenvolveu um conjunto de conceitos para facilitar o trabalho de engenharia. Aplicando tais conceitos, este trabalho desenvolveu sequкncias de atividades que descrevem o mйtodo proposto, sendo cada atividade detalhada por uma lista de requisitos. A demonstraзгo das vantagens do mйtodo proposto foi feita por meio de anбlise. Usando o mйtodo, esta tese desenvolveu especificaзхes e projetos em vбrios nнveis (empresarial, usina, caldeira nuclear, circuito primбrio e gerador de vapor). Baseando-se em dados da marinha americana, esta tese desenvolveu um modelo de custo para reatores de pequeno porte. Concluiu que a energia nuclear pode ser competitiva se a potкncia elйtrica mйdia efetiva ao longo da vida ъtil ficar acima de 30MW e se o tempo de vida ъtil for igual ou maior do que 60 anos. Tal fato decorre dos altos custos de aquisiзгo que requerem uma vida longa para compensar o investimento e dos efeitos de economia de escala especialmente pronunciados para reatores a бgua pressurizada.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: The importance of design methodologies has been growing in recent years as complex socio-technical systems become more common. In addition to complexity, the size and financial investment of these systems amplifies the severity of design errors. The general goal of this work was to develop a specification and design methodology that reduces the time and energy to develop a complex system whose functions are known a priori, managing the risks in parallel. The specific goal was to verify if small modular reactors could be economically possible. This work adopted as principle the Constructal law, that predicts the success of systems that ease the necessary flows to its existence. After finding the key factors to ease the flow of information, this work developed a set of concepts to ease the engineering work. Applying such concepts, this work developed sequences of activities describing the proposed methodology. Lists of requirements guided each activity. Analysis showed the advantages of the proposed methodology. Using the methodology, this work developed specifications and designs at many product breakdown levels (enterprise, nuclear power plant, nuclear steam supply system, reactor coolant system and steam generator). Using data from US Navy, this work developed a cost model for small reactors. This work concluded that nuclear power may be competitive if average electrical power extracted during the life is larger than 30 MW and if life time is superior to 60 years. The first condition is consequence of the high overnight costs of nuclear power. The second is consequence of the strong scale economy effects of pressurized water reactors.

Estes animais nгo sгo agressivos, porйm devido a estes hбbitos, й grande a possibilidade de acidentes, ocorrendo quando os humanos casualmente pisam na parte dorsal destes animais, que utilizam a cauda para se defenderem e desferem ferroadas resultando na penetraзгo do aguilhгo no corpo da vнtima. Estes acidentes ocorrem principalmente no perнodo de estiagem na regiгo norte do paнs quando os rios estгo mais rasos. Sгo descritos vбrios casos de acidentes por raias na literatura e os ferimentos provocados pelos ferrхes destes animais sгo dolorosos, de difнcil cicatrizaзгo, causam necroses extensas e, por vezes, fenфmenos sistкmicos. Estas manifestaзхes clнnicas estгo desencadeadas pela aзгo das proteнnas bioativas presentes no veneno e no muco. O presente trabalho tem por objetivo fazer uma caracterizaзгo bioquнmica de forma preliminar do muco da raia Paratrygon aiereba. DADOS-BASICOS-DE-ORIENTACOES-CONCLUIDAS-.TITULO-INGLES: Immunohistochemical and epidemiological profile of Leishmania in dogs in the municipality of Porto Nacional-Tocantins

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: A Leishmaniose й uma doenзa parasitбria que se apresenta sob vбrias formas clнnicas, desde as formas mucocutвnea atй a visceral que й a forma mais grave da doenзa. Essa doenзa й causada por um parasita flagelado do gкnero Leishmania e apresenta um ciclo de vida heterуxeno, envolvendo o repasto sanguнneo da fкmea de flebotomнneo em animais silvestres e domйsticos, como os cгes, bem como no homem. Atй o momento, o controle da Leishmaniose Visceral (LV) estб associado a eliminaзгo de reservatуrio infectado (cгes), porйm isso requer mйtodos de diagnуsticos confiбveis. Nesse estudo, foi utilizado a PCR diagnуstica a partir das sequкncias spliced leader de RNA (mini-exon) com imunohisquнmico utilizando leishmanias spp. marcadas com anticorpos policlonais de biуpsias embebidas em parafina. Alйm disso, utilizamos dados epidemiolуgicos de Leishmaniose canina e humana do municнpio de Porto Nacional e do estado Tocantins. Todos os fragmentos de fнgado, baзo e linfonodo apresentaram amplificaзгo para L. infantum e nenhuma para L. braziliensis e L. amazonensis, no que se refere ao IHQ, houve fraca replicabilidade. O P-valor obtido (0,0077) й significativo (p?0,05), denotando nгo haver concordвncias entre os dois testes PCR e IHQ. Quanto aos dados epidemiolуgicos, eles indicam que o nъmero de cгes com leishmaniose visceral permaneceu inalterado com tendкncias a elevaзгo em Porto nacional e quanto aos casos humanos apresentou declнnio, apesar de estatisticamente insignificativo, com elevaзгo no ano de 2015. No universo amostral de cгes avaliados, a Leishmania infantum foi espйcie predominante dentre as trкs pesquisadas, nгo apresentando perfil de infecзгo canina para a L. braziliensis e L. amazonensis e nem co-infecзгo, denotando que os cгes, foram os reservatуrios para a L. infantum. Observou-se tambйm que a PCR й mais sensнvel para o diagnуstico da Leishmania que o Imunohistoquнmico. E quanto aos dados epidemiolуgicos verificou-se que a transmissгo canina, pode estar preceden
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Leishmaniasis is a parasitic disease that presents in various clinical forms, from mucocutaneous to visceral forms; whitch is the most severe form of disease. This disease is caused by a flagellate parasite of the genus Leishmania and presents a heterodox life cycle, involving the sanguine repast of the female phlebotomine in wild and domestic animals like the dogs as well as the man. Until now, control of the LV is associated with container disposal (dogs) infected, but this requires reliable diagnostic methods. In this study, diagnostic PCR was used from the spliced leader sequences of RNA (mini-exon) with immunohischemistry using leishmaniasis spp, labeled with paraffin embedded polyclonal biopsy antibodies. In addition, we used epidemiological data on canine and human Leishmaniasis from Porto Nacional and Tocantins. All liver, spleen and lymph node fragments showed amplification for L. infantum and none for L. braziliensis and L. amazonensis, as far as IHC was concerned, there was poor replicability. The P-value obtained (0.0077) is significant (p <0.05), indicating that there is no agreement between the two tests PCR and IHC. Regarding the epidemiological data, they indicate that the number of dogs with visceral leishmaniasis remains unchanged with tendencies to elevation in the national port and as for the human cases presented decline, although statistically insignificant, with elevation in the year 2015. In the sample universe of evaluated dogs, Leishmania infantum was predominated among the three surveyed, showing no canine infection profile for L. braziliensis and L. amazonensis or cluck-infection, indicating that dogs were the reservoirs for L Infantum. It was also observed that the PCR is more sensitive for the diagnosis of Leishmania than the Immunohistochemical. Concerning the epidemiological data it was found that canine transmission may be preceding human transmission.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Este trabalho tem por objetivo desenvolver os estudos inicias para o ?Projeto de Investigaзгo de Velocidade Crнtica e Vibraзхes Induzidas em escoamentos de refrigerante do tipo бgua leve em reatores com elementos combustнveis tipo placas paralelas?. A velocidade crнtica й a velocidade na qual placas retangulares irгo flambar e colapsar umas nas outras como resultado de vibraзхes induzidas por escoamento e consequentemente distribuiзгo assimйtrica de pressхes. Este fenфmeno representa uma importante consideraзгo no projeto de reatores nucleares com elementos combustнveis do tipo placas paralelas. O Reator Multipropуsito Brasileiro (RMB), que estб sendo concebido e projetado pela Comissгo Nacional de Energia Nuclear (CNEN), deverб utilizar um nъcleo composto por elementos combustнveis formado por placas retangulares, o que justifica a importвncia dos estudos as serem realizadas.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Este trabalho visa atender as necessidades dos usuбrios do RELAP5, atravйs do desenvolvimento do Programa de Cбlculo do REI_AP5 - PCRELAP5 - onde foram codificados todos os componentes que constituem o cуdigo, neste caso, todos os cartхes de entrada inclusive os opcionais de cada um deles foram programados. Tambйm um design amigбvel do PCRELAP5 foi desenvolvido com a finalidade de minimizar o tempo de preparaзгo dos dados de entrada e diminuir os erros cometidos pelos usuбrios do cуdigo RELAP5. Nesse trabalho, a versгo final desse prй-processador foi aplicada com sucesso para o Sistema de Injeзгo de Emergкncia (SIE) da Usina Angra 2.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: In order to meet the needs of RELAP5 users, the RELAP5 Calculation Program (Programa de Cбlculo do RELAP5 - PCRELAP5) was designed. The components of the code were codified; all entry cards including the optional cards of each one have been programmed. Furthermore, a friendly design was developed in order to minimize the time of preparation of input data and errors committed by users. In this work, the final version of this preprocessor was successfully applied for the Safety Injection System (SIS) of Angra 2.
